titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the T.S. Eliot Collection ca. 1892-1986, and undated
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections
The University of Virginia Library 12248
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: T.S. Eliot Collection ca. 1892-1986, and undated
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. sixty items (one Hollinger box, ca. .5 linear feet).
did.origination: These items were originally part of a collection of books and papers owned by Donald Gallup.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: T.S. Eliot Collection, Accession #12248, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were originally part of a collection of books and papers owned by Donald Gallup and sold to the University of Virginia Library by Waiting for Godot Books, Hadley, Massachusetts; non-book items were transferred to the Manuscripts Division on July 26, 2002.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Donald Gallup was the Curator of the Collection of American Literature at Yale University Library, New Haven, Connecticut, and a member of the T.S. Eliot Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of ca. sixty items (one Hollinger box), ca. 1892-1986, and undated, all pertaining to author T.S. Eliot and his life and work, including manuscripts or copies of manuscripts, correspondence, photographs, and memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The folders are arranged in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Photograph of T.S. Eliot as a child [ca. 1892]
Photograph of Eastern Point, Gloucester, Massachusetts ca. 1900
Notes by T.S. Eliot on Aristotle's Analyticorum Posteriorum, page 55 [ca. 1913]

scopecontent.p: The book was owned by Eliot in his post-graduate years at Harvard University (a photostatic copy with a typed note about the original in the Widener Library).

did.unittitle: Harvard University Tuition Receipt made out to T.S. Eliot, stamped paid on February 5, 1913 by bursar 1913 Feb 5
"The Death of Saint Narcissus" by T.S. Eliot [1915 Oct]

scopecontent.p: This is a photostatic copy of the original canceled galley proof which was scheduled for publication in Poetrybut withdrawn before publication.

did.unittitle: Photograph of T.S. Eliot, possibly taken on a Cunard Line sea voyage [ca. 1921]
"The Prophet of the Waste Land - T.S. Eliot" by Walter Hanks Shaw [ca. 1928]
"Marina" by T.S. Eliot 1930 May 9

scopecontent.p: Photostatic copies of the Typescript and Manuscript versions; and a Photostatic copy of a Postscript of a letter from Eliot to Sir Michael Sadler, describing his writing method in the poem

did.unittitle: Postal card from T.S. Eliot to the Librarian of Congress, Herbert Putnam 1934 & 1938

scopecontent.p: Eliot writes regarding "Ezra Pound: His Metric and Poetry," a negative photostatic copy; with a typed note from a Library of Congress cataloger to D.C. Gallup about the postal card

did.unittitle: "Some Uses of the Poetry of T.S. Eliot" by Elizabeth Wheeler Manwaring [late 1930's]
Correspondence of T.S. Eliot and Ashley Dukes, Martin Browne, and Frank V. Morley 1938 Mar-Apr

scopecontent.p: Typescript Copies, regarding the original production of Eliot's play, The Family Reunion

did.unittitle: Photograph of T.S. Eliot by E. McKnight Kauffer, London 1939
Photograph of T.S. Eliot seated at a typewriter, taken by Jarlas Foto copyright by Ahlen & Akerlind Studio, Stockholm 1942
Photographs of Little Gidding Church by Donald Gallup 1943 Feb
The Columbia Workshop Script for readings from T.S. Eliot's Four Quartets 1946 Mar 16

scopecontent.p: These include "Burnt Norton" read by John Hall Wheelock and "Little Gidding" read by James Johnson Sweeney.

did.unittitle: Emilio Ceechi, Italian scholar and Eliot translator, to Bernard Wall 1946 Dec 23

scopecontent.p: Autograph Post Card Signed, mentioning a recent long and interesting talk with Eliot

did.unittitle: "Incontro Con T.S. Eliot" by Emilio Cecchi [1946]
Donald Gallup to [John Cook] Wyllie 1947 Jun 1

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for the McGregor Seminar programs and notes about the Italian translations in Sud

did.unittitle: "A Personal Anthology" by T.S. Eliot [1948] Feb 22

scopecontent.p: Typed Manuscript, 18 pages; originally may have been written for a BBC appearance, then a copy was sent to Donald Gallup, who read the text at Yale University.

did.unittitle: Photograph of T.S. Eliot, publicity shot by Angus McBean, Eliot shown seated, from the waist up [ca. 1940's]
Jeannette Lowrey to Van Allen Bradley, Literary Editor, of The Daily News 1950 Oct 12

scopecontent.p: Lowrey urges him to listen to the lectures of T.S. Eliot, praising his literary allusions, and suggests he do an interview with Eliot while he is at the University of Chicago, Typed Letter Signed

did.unittitle: Photograph of T.S. Eliot standing before a tall bookcase, probably taken when Eliot delivered a series of lectures at the University of Chicago [ca. 1950]
Yale Reports on the Arts & Sciences 1959 Mar 4

scopecontent.p: - "T.S. Eliot: The Four QuartetsA Conversation for Television between Edith Kerr and Norman Holmes Pearson, 7 pages

did.unittitle: "The Art of Fiction XXIV: T.S. Eliot" An Interview in The Paris Reviewconducted by Donald Hall [1959]

Correspondence concerning The T.S. Eliot Newsletterand related topics, chiefly between Donald Gallup, Curator Collection of American Literature, Yale University Library, and Editor Shyamal Bagchee
1973-1982
Selected Prose of T.S. Eliot, edited with introduction by Frank Kermode [1975]

scopecontent.p: Uncorrected Page Proof, Electrostatic Copy (2 folders)

did.unittitle: Postcards from the National Portrait Gallery featuring an abstract painting of Eliot by Patrick Heron and a plaster cast of a bust of Eliot by Sir Jacob Epstein [1970's]
T.S. Eliot Society Membership Certificate for Donald Gallup 1986 Sep 26
Autograph Note "Please inscribe for Miss Emily Hal[e?][blank] Prufrock" in ink and signed by T.S. Eliot as "Done TSE" in pencil n.d.
Photographs of "The Dry Salvages," and Exhibition of Eliot books by Donald Gallup at [Yale University?], Magdalene College Hall post card photograph, and T.S. Eliot portrait snapshot n.d.
"La Terre Mise A Nu" n.d.
"Notes on Eliot's Epigraphs" from Jane Worthington's typescript "The Epigraphs to the Poetry of T.S. Eliot" n.d.
